alert.note: Alert for Southern Gila Foothills, Mimbres Valley; Southern Gila Highlands, Black Range (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued June 11 at 8:22PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TO 1 PM MDT SUNDAY... The New Mexico Departments of Health and Environment has issued an Air Quality Alert, from 6 AM to 1 PM MDT Sunday. * WHAT... New Midnight Fire in Rio Arriba County is burning at the edge of private lands in Potrero Canyon. Winds will be out of the west-northwest today with sustained winds around 13 mph to possibly cause smoke to drift into Taos County and further south. Smoke from new fires in western areas of the state and the two largest fires will tend to drift toward the southeast through the remainder of the afternoon and evening. Light and more variable wind conditions expected in the vicinity of the Black fire. Significant impacts from new and residual smoke will be localized and in close proximity to individual fires through Sunday morning. New fires caused by recent lightning activity may also contribute additional smoke to regional airsheds going into Sunday as hot and dry conditions dominate. * WHERE... Significant smoke impacts will be localized across portions of Taos, northern Grant and western Sierra counties. Elsewhere, brief moderate impacts are expected at times between the Rio Grande Valley and Continental Divide but widespread unhealthy conditions are not expected. More details and latest air quality information can be found at https://fire.airnow.gov * WHEN... Remainder of this afternoon through at least 1 PM MDT Sunday, June 12th.
